intro: Minuartia stojanovii subsp. pirinica, commonly known as the Pirin rockcress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial plant characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically features bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Pirin Mountains in Bulgaria. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are adapted to withstand harsh mountain conditions.
